name: Kubernetes - Collection Healthcheck (otelcol)
description: The Kubernetes - Collection Health Check dashboard displays collection status from otel components in the Kubernetes cluster.
title: Kubernetes - Collection Healthcheck (otelcol)

queries.queryString: cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}}  pod=*-sumologic-* metric=otelcol_process_cpu_seconds | quantize 1m using max | delta increasing  | avg by cluster,container, pod | sum by cluster,pod

cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} metric= otelcol_process_memory_rss 
| quantize 1m using avg | avg by cluster,container, pod | sum by cluster,pod
cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} metric= otelcol_otelsvc_k8s_pod_deleted  |count
cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} metric= otelcol_exporter_queue_size  | quantize 1m using avg  | avg by container, pod | sum by pod
cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} metric= otelcol_otelsvc_k8s_pod_added   |  count

panels.title: Untitled
panels.text:
# What does Red Indicate?

### If one of the panels goes red, it means that Prometheus was unable to scrape from that endpoint. This will result in some set of metrics not being visible inside of Sumo Logic.

queries.queryString: cluster={{cluster}} metric=up  | quantize  2m |  sum
cluster={{cluster}} metric=up  | quantize  2m |  sum
cluster={{cluster}} metric=up job=*dns* | quantize 2m |  sum
cluster={{cluster}}  metric=up job=apiserver | quantize 2m |  sum
cluster={{cluster}}  metric=up job=kubelet | quantize 2m |  sum
cluster={{cluster}} metric=up job=kube-state-metrics | quantize 2m |  sum
cluster={{cluster}}  metric=up  job=node-exporter | quantize 2m |  sum
cluster={{cluster}} metric=up (job=*prom*) | quantize 2m |  sum
metric=prometheus_remote_storage_failed_samples_total cluster={{cluster}} | rate
metric=prometheus_remote_storage_succeeded_samples_total cluster={{cluster}} | rate
metric=prometheus_remote_storage_succeeded_samples_total cluster={{cluster}} | rate
metric=prometheus_remote_storage_pending_samples | rate
metric=up cluster={{cluster}} | quantize 2m | sum by job, instance, endpoint| topk(500,max)
cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} statefulset=*otelcol-logs* metric=kube_statefulset_status_replicas | quantize using max

cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} statefulset=*otelcol-logs* metric=container_memory_working_set_bytes 
| quantize 1m using avg | avg by cluster, pod //| sum by cluster, pod
cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} statefulset=*otelcol-logs* metric=container_cpu_usage_seconds_total | quantize 1m using max | rate increasing |  avg by cluster, pod
cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} statefulset=*otelcol* metric=container_cpu_cfs_throttled_seconds_total pod=*logs* | rate increasing
cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} statefulset=*otelcol* metric=otelcol_exporter_queue_size service=*metadata-logs* | quantize 1m using avg  | avg by cluster,service, pod

(cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}}) statefulset=*otelcol-logs* ("502 Bad Gateway" or "503 Service Unavailable")
_sourcecategory=*otelcol*
| parse regex "(?<code>502 Bad Gateway|503 Service Unavailable)"
| timeslice //5m
| concat (cluster,":",code) as cluster_type
| count as count by _timeslice,cluster_type
| transpose row _timeslice column cluster_type
cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} statefulset=*otelcol-metrics* metric=kube_statefulset_status_replicas | quantize using max
cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} statefulset=*otelcol-metrics* metric=container_memory_working_set_bytes | quantize 1m using avg | avg by cluster,container, pod | sum by cluster,pod

cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} statefulset=*otelcol-metrics* metric=container_cpu_usage_seconds_total | rate increasing | quantize 1m using avg | avg by cluster,container, pod | sum by cluster,pod
cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} statefulset=*otelcol-metrics* metric=otelcol_exporter_queue_size |quantize 1m using avg  | avg by container, pod | sum by pod

(cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}}) statefulset=*otelcol-metrics.* "502 Bad Gateway"
| timeslice 5m
| count as count by _timeslice,pod
| transpose row _timeslice column pod
cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} statefulset=*otelcol-metrics* metric=container_cpu_cfs_throttled_seconds_total | rate increasing

cluster={{cluster}} metric= otelcol_process_memory_rss 
| quantize 1m using avg  | avg by container, pod | sum by pod

panels.title: Queue Retries Exceeded, Queue Full Etc

queries.queryString:
_sourceCategory=*otelcol* cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}}

("No more retries" or "sender failed" or "Dropping data" or "max elapsed time expired" or "sending_queue is full")
| json field=_raw "log" 
| parse field=log "*\t*\t*:*\t*\t*" as datetime,level,file,line,error_type,details nodrop	
| where level matches /warn|error|fatal/
| parse regex field=log "(?<some_json>\{.+\})" nodrop
//| json field=some_json "action" nodrop
| json field=some_json "error" nodrop
//| json field=some_json "data_type" nodrop
//| json field=some_json "name" nodrop
| json field=some_json "kind" nodrop
| json field=some_json "pipeline" nodrop
| if (length(error)>200,concat(substring(error,0,200),"..."),error) as error
| count by cluster,pod,level,file,error_type,error,kind,pipeline |sort _count

panels.title: Pod Logs: Queue Retries Exceeded, Queue Full Etc
Kubernetes Events For Collection Containers: otelcol, fluentd, prometheus, falco
panels.text: You must be collecting kubenernetes events ```cluster=*  _sourceCategory=*events ``` via k8s collection and have these in a accessible partition (continous or default scope for flex).

queries.queryString:
cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}}
 _sourceCategory=*events 
not "\"type\":\"Normal\""
(otelcol or prometheus or falco or otelagent or otelgateway)
// exclude any annoying messages here
involvedObject
not "Nameserver limits were exceeded"
not "Liveness probe failed"
| json field=_raw "object.reason" as reason
| json field=_raw "object.involvedObject.kind" as type
| json field=_raw "object.involvedObject.name" as name
| json field=_raw "object.type" as level
| json field=_raw "object.message" as message
| json field=_raw "object.metadata.namespace" as namespace
| count by cluster,reason,type,level,namespace,name,message
| sort _count

panels.title: Kubernetes Events Not Normal State Over Time By Reason

queries.queryString:
_sourceCategory=*otelcol* cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}}
// exclude chatty
not (tinfo and !(err* or warn* or fail* or retr*))
| json field=_raw "log"
| parse field=log "*\t*\t*\t*" as datetime,level,logger,event
| parse regex field=event "(?<json_data>\{.+\})"
| parse regex field=event "^(?<event_prefix>[^\r\n\{]+)" nodrop
| json field=json_data "error" nodrop
| json field=json_data "message" nodrop
| json field=json_data "code" nodrop
//| json field=json_data "status" nodrop
| json field=json_data "name" nodrop
//| json field=json_data "kind" nodrop

| if(isempty(message),error,message) as description

| where !(event_prefix matches "*started.")
| where !(event_prefix matches "Starting*")
| values(pod) as pods,count by cluster,namespace,level,event_prefix,description | sort _count

panels.title: Container Events For otelcol Over Time
panels.visualSettings: {"title":{"fontSize":14},"axes":{"axisX":{"titleFontSize":12,"labelFontSize":12},"axisY":{"titleFontSize":12,"labelFontSize":12,"logarithmic":false}},"legend":{"enabled":true,"verticalAlign":"bottom","fontSize":12,"maxHeight":150,"showAsTable":true,"wrap":true,"shownStatistics":["sum"]},"color":{"family":"Categorical Default"},"series":{"A_Exporting failed. Will retry the request after interval.\t":{"visible":true},"A_There was an issue sending data\t":{"visible":true},"A_resolve attributes: %!w(*fs.PathError=&":{"visible":true}},"general":{"type":"column","displayType":"stacked","roundDataPoints":true,"fillOpacity":1,"mode":"timeSeries"},"overrides":[]}

panels.title: Logs Pods
panels.text:
These pods collect, enrich and forward logs to sumologic. For more info see: [Collecting Logs Docs](https://help.sumologic.com/docs/send-data/kubernetes/collecting-logs/).

There are two layers in archtecutre:
1. a daemonset with a pod per node collecting logs locally and forwarding to level 2. These pods have names like: sumo-otelcol-logs-collector-cbh5t 
2. autoscaled statefulset/service: these pods enrich with metadata via the k8s_tagger processor via k8s apis, can perform transformations or filters, and are responsible for sending logs to the "logs-otlp" or "logs" sources at Sumo Logic. These pods have names like: sumo-otelcol-logs-0

For log event panels from otelcol containers watch out for any of these events they mean retry is failed
- Sender failed	... sending queue is full
- Dropping data because sending_queue is full. Try increasing queue_size.	
- Exporting failed. The error is not retryable. Dropping data.
- Status Code 500, Message=data refused due to high memory usage; data refused due to high memory usage

Could have memory issues in pod
- Memory usage is above hard limit. Forcing a GC.

These will always happen in very small % - retries should be ok but watch for large volumes
- Exporting failed. Will retry the request after interval.
- failed to decode API response (status: 502 Bad Gateway)

panels.title: Level 2 Logs Gateway Pods e.g sumo-otelcol-logs-0

queries.queryString: cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} statefulset=*otelcol* metric=otelcol_exporter_send_failed_log_records service=*metadata-logs* | quantize 1m using sum  | sum by cluster,service, pod

cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} statefulset=*otelcol* metric=otelcol_exporter_sent_log_records service=*metadata-logs* 
| quantize 1m using max 
| delta increasing  | sum by cluster,service, pod

cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} statefulset=*otelcol* metric=otelcol_exporter_requests_bytes service=*metadata-logs* 
| quantize 1m using max
| delta increasing | sum by cluster,service, pod
cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} statefulset=*otelcol* metric=otelcol_exporter_queue_size service=*metadata-logs* | quantize 1m using avg  | avg by cluster,service, pod
cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} statefulset=*otelcol* metric=otelcol_exporter_queue_capacity  service=*metadata-logs* | quantize 1m using max | avg by cluster,service, pod
100 * (#A / #B) along cluster,service, pod

panels.title: Error and Warn Logs for Log *otelcol* pods
panels.text:
For log event panels from otelcol containers watch out for any of these events they mean retry is failed
- Sender failed	... sending queue is full
- Dropping data because sending_queue is full. Try increasing queue_size.	
- Exporting failed. The error is not retryable. Dropping data.
- Status Code 500, Message=data refused due to high memory usage; data refused due to high memory usage

Could have memory issues in pod
- Memory usage is above hard limit. Forcing a GC.

These will always happen in very small % - retries should be ok but watch for large volumes
- Exporting failed. Will retry the request after interval.
- failed to decode API response (status: 502 Bad Gateway)

panels.title: No Info Events- over time by level
Level 1 Logs Per Node Collector Pods e.g sumo-otelcol-logs-collector-cbh5t

queries.queryString: cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} daemonset=*otelcol* metric=container_cpu_cfs_throttled_seconds_total | rate increasing

(cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}}) daemonset=*otelcol-logs* ("502 Bad Gateway" or "503 Service Unavailable")
_sourcecategory=*otelcol*
| parse regex "(?<code>502 Bad Gateway|503 Service Unavailable)"
| timeslice //5m
| concat (cluster,":",code) as cluster_type
| count as count by _timeslice,cluster_type
| transpose row _timeslice column cluster_type
cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} daemonset=*otelcol* metric=otelcol_exporter_queue_size | quantize 1m using avg  | avg by cluster,daemonset, pod //| sum by cluster,daemonset,pod
cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} daemonset=*otelcol* metric=otelcol_exporter_send_failed_log_records  | quantize 1m using sum  | sum by cluster,daemonset, pod
cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} daemonset=*otelcol* metric=otelcol_exporter_queue_size  | quantize 1m using avg  | avg by cluster,daemonset, pod
cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} daemonset=*otelcol* metric=otelcol_exporter_queue_capacity   | quantize 1m using max | avg by cluster,daemonset, pod
100 * (#A / #B) along cluster,daemonset, pod

cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} service=*otelcol-logs-collector metric=kube_pod_container_info pod=*collector* | quantize to 1m using avg  | sum by cluster,pod,service //| count by cluster,service

cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} service=sumo-otelcol-logs-collector metric=container_memory_working_set_bytes 
| quantize 1m using avg | avg by cluster,service, pod  //| sum by cluster, pod

cluster={{cluster}} namespace={{namespace}} service=sumo-otelcol-logs-collector metric=container_cpu_usage_seconds_total
| quantize 1m using max | rate increasing |  avg by cluster, pod
